comment: Prof. Cox is awesome and a really good professor. Her essay topics are all based around music, which made it super easy to write because it was about things I cared about versus random prompts. As long as you put effort into your essays then you can easily pass.

I had this class online- no mandatory attendance. She uploads weekly videos and you do them when you want. Very easy class, only 3 papers, class focused on music. She's very sweet and passionate about what she teaches. Her feedback on writing is clear and detailed oriented. The weekly work took me 10 minutes max.

TAKE THIS CLASS! Professor Cox is the best professor ever, she explains instructions for all her assignments very well and she is very easy to reach. This class is an easy A, she doesnt offer extra credit but you honestly really dont need it. The course is music based so all your assignments are based off artist that you like.

The actual best professor I have ever had. She themes her classes so mine was music themed. She takes time to post videos for her online classes and goes in depth with descriptions of how to complete assignments. One of the best classes I have taken and if I could take her every semester for English I definitely would!

One of the best professors I have ever had. She really cares for her students and our futures. Just show up to class, do the modules, and all of her assignments and you will do well. She doesn't give extra credit or accepts any type of excuse if you are sick so the grade you get is what you deserve.

Professor Cox was wonderful. For this class, you have weekly modules, a resume, a cover letter, a pro bio, one research paper, and a final presentation based on your research paper topic. She's super sweet. To do good you mostly just have to show up and listen to her feedback. I wish I could take her again for world literature!
VERY easy A and you learn a lot. As long as you do the weekly modules and listen to her feedback on the ONE essay youre assigned, you will get a good grade. Definitely take her if you have the chance
Professor Cox is GREAT! There's only 2 papers and they are extremely easy! Final was a podcast which was an easy A. My class was a hybrid so we had homework assignments due mostly every week.

In this class, there were 2 papers and a final podcast project that was unbelievably easy. There were weekly online modules that were basically participation, though some had quizzes. She's an amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students, and I loved her so much that I'm taking her for 1102. 10/10 would recommend! :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: A very nice and generous woman. We had 2 essays the entire semester. She would make us to I'm our rough drafts and then send it back to us with alot of feedback. If you make the changes she suggested then more than likely you make A's on your papers! She is very reliable, so don't hesitate to ask her questions. I'm taking her again for spring!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Cox is such a kind and wonderful teacher. I took the hybrid World Literature course and had a blast in that class. All of the assignments were easy, and she would grade fairly. She gladly helped any students who asked for assistance, and she made her lectures entertaining throughout the semester.

Ended up with Prof. Cox after KSU switched my prof, but she was great! We had one narrative essay and one persuasive (the final essay). We also had a group project podcast for the final. After the peer review, she goes through and gives THOROUGH feedback to help you get an A on your final draft. Takes a while to grade because of the feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Cox was so nice and always told great stories. We only had 2.5 papers and for the big two she provided amazing feedback which allowed me to get a great grade in my class. She gives a detailed schedule about when attendance will be taken for a grade, but when I had a mission trip, she was understanding and did not count off.

Professor Cox is a sweet professor. In Eng1101 We only had 3.5 papers (One was basically just a paragraph to start the final paper). She's very kind in making sure her students understand what is going on. In this class, your grade depends a lot on showing up, so it's best not to skip class. Class can be boring at times, but overall easy and good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Cox is a wonderful teacher. When turning in rough drafts, she will give you tons of feedback so that way you will make an A+ in your final drafts. If you can't understand something she's super nice when helping you. I took her for Eng1101, and we only had two papers. I plan on taking her again for Eng1102.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super sweet lady! Only assigned four papers for the whole semester. Short essays with clear grading criteria. She themes her curriculum for the semester (ex. our class was based on music). Made English pretty enjoyable. She also makes it easy for you to boost your grade by just showing up to class and doing in class activities. Great professor!
